content:
• Tuesday, June 4, 2013
  • AMBA

    More on Ambarella (NASDAQ:AMBA): Q1 easily beats across the board as total sales jump by 30%...

    More on Ambarella (NASDAQ:AMBA): Q1 easily beats across the board as total sales jump by 30% from the prior year. Net profit soared 82% on strong growth in its Internet-protocol security camera and wearable sports camera markets. Gross margin narrowed however, to 63.9% from 71%, as input costs jumped 63%. Shares +10.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:57 PM
  • SHFL

    More on SHFL Entertainment (NASDAQ:SHFL): FQ2 beats both EPS and revenue estimates. Net profit...

    More on SHFL Entertainment (NASDAQ:SHFL): FQ2 beats both EPS and revenue estimates. Net profit rose 22% on record revenue in its slot machine, shuffler, and specialty table games businesses. Its leasing and royalties business saw revenue improve 8.5% to $29.2M, while product sales and service reported 23% higher revenue at $48.2M. Gross margin edged up to 64.7% from 64.3%, as total costs and expenses grew 16% to $27.3 million. Shares +5.1% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:47 PM
  • BV-OLD

    More on Bazaarvoice (NASDAQ:BV-OLD): FQ4 beats across the board. Net loss widened however, on...

    More on Bazaarvoice (NASDAQ:BV-OLD): FQ4 beats across the board. Net loss widened however, on higher sales and marketing costs and acquisition-related expenses, which masked double-digit revenue growth. Gross margin edged up to 67.3% from 67.2%, although input costs were up 37% and sales and marketing expenses jumped 61%. Shares +4.8% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:30 PM | 1 Comment
  • GA

    Giant Interactive (NYSE:GA) -5.9% AH after filing to sell 15.1M shares (6.3% of outstanding...

    Giant Interactive (NYSE:GA) -5.9% AH after filing to sell 15.1M shares (6.3% of outstanding shares) on behalf of a Virgin Islands-based holdings company owned by founder/chairman Yuzhu Shi's daughter. Following the offering, Shi's effective ownership stake in Giant will fall to 48.5% from 54.8%. News of the offering comes with shares of the Chinese game developer having closed near multi-year highs. (prospectus)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:37 PM
  • AMBA

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: AMBA +9%. SHFL +5%. MFRM +5%. BOBE +4%. PKD-OLD +3%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: AMBA +9%. SHFL +5%. MFRM +5%. BOBE +4%. PKD-OLD +3%.
    After-hours top losers: FRA -3%. PBF -2%. SXCP -1%. JHS -1%. WMK -1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:30 PM
  • BOBE

    More on Bob Evans (NASDAQ:BOBE): FQ4 earnings beat across the board. Net profit jumped 23% Y/Y...

    More on Bob Evans (NASDAQ:BOBE): FQ4 earnings beat across the board. Net profit jumped 23% Y/Y due to a tax benefit, which masked losses related to the sale of its Mimi's Cafe franchise and weaker overall revenue. Same-store sales edged up 0.5% at its namesake restaurants, though overall sales were down 1.3%. Looking forward, the company lowered earnings guidance for the new fiscal year. It now expects to earn between $2.60 to $2.67, below Street estimates for $2.71. Shares +3.9% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:17 PM
  • MFRM

    More on Mattress Firm's (NASDAQ:MFRM) Q1: A 31.5% increase in quarterly revenue reflects...

    More on Mattress Firm's (NASDAQ:MFRM) Q1: A 31.5% increase in quarterly revenue reflects "incremental sales from new and acquired stores," partially offset by negative comps growth (-5.2%). 46 new stores were opened during the quarter. Operating margin falls 50 basis points to 8.6%. The company reaffirms its full year guidance of $1.90-1.98/share (adjusted) on $1.237-1.25B in revenue versus consensus of $1.96/share on $1.23B in sales. Shares +6.5%. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:13 PM

  • Wix, a top provider of web site development tools/templates and hosting services for consumers...

    Wix, a top provider of web site development tools/templates and hosting services for consumers and small businesses, has confidentially filed for an IPO - Globes claims the Israel-based company is looking to raise $75M at a $400M valuation. Wix claims 31.5M sites have been built using its tools, generates revenue by selling premium plans that offer features such as extra storage and bandwidth. The company launched an app market and mobile-friendly HTML5 tools last year.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:05 PM
  • MIND

    More on Mitcham Industries (NASDAQ:MIND): Q1 earnings miss across the board. Net profit fell 25%...

    More on Mitcham Industries (NASDAQ:MIND): Q1 earnings miss across the board. Net profit fell 25% Y/Y as the seismic-equipment supplier posted weaker revenue, although margins improved to 53.5% from 48.8% on a 28% decline in input costs. Equipment-leasing revenue, its biggest top-line contributor, slipped 4.4% on continued softness in land leasing activity and a temporary slowdown in marine leasing. Shares -1.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM
  • AMBA

    Ambarella (NASDAQ:AMBA): Q1 EPS of $0.21 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $33.9M (+30.9% Y/Y) beats by...

    Ambarella (NASDAQ:AMBA): Q1 EPS of $0.21 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $33.9M (+30.9% Y/Y) beats by $2M. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:28 PM
  • BV-OLD

    Bazaarvoice (NASDAQ:BV-OLD): FQ4 EPS of -$0.12 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $43.3M beats by...

    Bazaarvoice (NASDAQ:BV-OLD): FQ4 EPS of -$0.12 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $43.3M beats by $0.81M. Shares +5.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:14 PM
  • END

    Trading note: Endeavour (END +8%) spiked on high volume during the final hour of trading,...

    Trading note: Endeavour (END +8%) spiked on high volume during the final hour of trading, closing near its high with no specific news driver.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM | 1 Comment
  • SHFL

    Shuffle Master (NASDAQ:SHFL): FQ2 EPS of $0.21 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $77.4M beats by...

    Shuffle Master (NASDAQ:SHFL): FQ2 EPS of $0.21 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $77.4M beats by $5.83M. Shares +5.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM
  • S

    Sprint's (S +1%) board is thinking of delaying the company's June 12 shareholder vote on the...

    Sprint's (S +1%) board is thinking of delaying the company's June 12 shareholder vote on the SoftBank (OTCPK:SFTBF) deal to give Dish (DISH +0.3%) more time to strengthen its rival offer, Bloomberg reports. Though Sprint has appeared cool to Dish's overtures, a Dish spokesman states his company is still negotiating with Sprint. One source claims Dish, which recently raised $2.6B in debt, has lined up $9.3B in financing for its Sprint bid. Clearwire (CLWR -2.6%) has sold off to $4.31 today, below Dish's $4.40/share offer price, as investors weigh Sprint's legal assertions. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:54 PM
  • TOL

    Toll Brothers (TOL -1.2%) slips today, despite being upgraded to a Buy by analyst Megan McGrath...

    Toll Brothers (TOL -1.2%) slips today, despite being upgraded to a Buy by analyst Megan McGrath at MKM Partners. McGrath says that TOL's status as one of the more niche luxury homebuilders may become more valuable as the housing market continues to grow and lower end competition intensifies. She recommends investors buy the shares ahead of H213 as the stock could be pushed higher by the closing of the Touraine building.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:47 PM | 1 Comment
  • CAGDF

    Centerra Gold (OTCPK:CAGDF +5.8%) says it is in talks with the government of Kyrgyzstan about...

    Centerra Gold (OTCPK:CAGDF +5.8%) says it is in talks with the government of Kyrgyzstan about taking a direct stake in the Kumtor mine, which was shut down temporarily last week by protesters. A proposed deal would have the government exchange its 32.7% equity stake in Centerra for a stake of equivalent value in a joint-venture company that would own the Kumtor mine.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:34 PM
  • HMY

    A blip during a turnaround, or a new leg downward for gold miners (GDX -2.4%)? After stringing...

    A blip during a turnaround, or a new leg downward for gold miners (GDX -2.4%)? After stringing together several strong days, South African gold miners take a beating today as gold prices slide after a two-week rally: HMY -6.2%, SBGL -4.2%, AU -3.3%, GFI -2.2%. News that Barrick Gold (ABX -3.2%) will delay production at its Pascua-Lama mine may be adding to jitters over government risk.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:18 PM | 2 Comments
  • MDCO

    The Medicines Company (MDCO -1.4%) agrees to buy all of the outstanding capital stock of...

    The Medicines Company (MDCO -1.4%) agrees to buy all of the outstanding capital stock of ProFibrix, subject to the company's satisfactory review of the pending Phase 3 clinical trial results of ProFibrix's lead biologic Fibrocaps. Under the terms of the agreement, MDCO will pay ProFibrix a $10M upfront option payment. If the company is satisfied with the trial results of the trial and decides to proceed, it will purchase all of the outstanding capital stock of ProFibrix at closing.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:16 PM
  • CP

    RBC Capital puts a little more heft into Canadian Pacific's (CP -3.4%) slide, after it...

    RBC Capital puts a little more heft into Canadian Pacific's (CP -3.4%) slide, after it downgrades the shares to Underperform today with a price target of $100.78. The stock was already feeling the weight of Pershing Square's disclosure late yesterday that it intended to sell up to 7M shares, or roughly 30% of its outstanding stake.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:56 PM
  • P

    Pandora (P -4.1%) bleeds for the second day in a row (previous) on concerns about iRadio's...

    Pandora (P -4.1%) bleeds for the second day in a row (previous) on concerns about iRadio's impact. CFO Mike Herring's efforts at a BofA/Merrill conference to downplay the threat aren't doing much to help. A Bloomberg report claiming Apple is ramping its iRadio ad sales efforts and will share ad revenue with studios (apparently in return for playback options not supported by rivals) could be adding to the pressure. Will Apple disrupt Pandora in a way that Spotify, Amazon, Google, Sony, Microsoft, TuneIn, and Songza have thus far failed to?

     
     
     
     
    | 2:50 PM | 18 Comments
  • BOBS

    Shares of Brazil Fast Food (OTCPK:BOBS +7.7%) rise sharply in characteristically thin trading...

    Shares of Brazil Fast Food (OTCPK:BOBS +7.7%) rise sharply in characteristically thin trading after SA Pro contributor Nick Ghattas says the company "is about to become a cash cow [and has] significant competitive advantages" in an article published today (still under embargo).

     
     
     
     
    | 2:43 PM
  • MDGL

    Synta Pharmaceuticals (SNTA +2.7%) moves up today, after the company announced earlier that it...

    Synta Pharmaceuticals (SNTA +2.7%) moves up today, after the company announced earlier that it will be presenting at the Jefferies 2013 Global Healthcare Conference on Thursday, June 6, in New York.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:40 PM
  • FCX

    Copper rallies (JJC +1%) on expectations of tighter supplies, as the potential rises for an...

    Copper rallies (JJC +1%) on expectations of tighter supplies, as the potential rises for an extended shutdown at Freeport McMoRan's (FCX -2.5%) Grasberg copper and gold mining operation in Indonesia. If FCX were to declare force majeure, the shutdown could remove 100K-150K metric tons of copper supply from the market, a sizable chunk out of estimates of 600K-800K metric tons.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM
  • ELN

    Institutional Shareholder Services is recommending Elan (ELN +0.6%) shareholders vote against...

    Institutional Shareholder Services is recommending Elan (ELN +0.6%) shareholders vote against several company proposals - including a $1B royalty-sharing agreement with Theravance (THRX -1.5%) and a $200M stock buyback program at ELN's June 17 special meeting. It withholds recommendation on the Royalty all-cash offer however, although it said voting against ELN's proposals "leaves the door open for shareholders to tender their shares if they so wish."

     
     
     
     
    | 2:05 PM
  • RBCN

    Rubicon (RBCN +2.8%) jumps in response to an SA Pro article (still under embargo) from...

    Rubicon (RBCN +2.8%) jumps in response to an SA Pro article (still under embargo) from contributor Valuable Insights. The author argues the beaten-down and heavily-shorted LED wafer vendor is due to see an upcycle, thanks to strong LED lighting demand and an improving pricing environment (the current environment, in which 2" and 4" wafers are being sold below cost, is deemed "unsustainable"). Comparisons are made with Micron and First Solar, both of which have taken off since last fall with the help of improving cyclical conditions in their respective industries.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:54 PM
  • HALO

    The day chart for Halozyme Therapeutics (HALO -5.9%) looks almost identical to yesterday's...

    The day chart for Halozyme Therapeutics (HALO -5.9%) looks almost identical to yesterday's — and that is not a good thing. After briefly trading in positive territory, shares have fallen steadily throughout the session putting the two-day loss at ~8.4% as investors continue to unload their shares after the company presented data from a Phase 1b trial testing a PEGPH20/ gemcitabine combo in pancreatic cancer patients. (I, II)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:50 PM
  • MAIN

    Main Street Capital (MAIN -4.2%) continues for a 2nd day to bear the brunt of the selling in the...

    Main Street Capital (MAIN -4.2%) continues for a 2nd day to bear the brunt of the selling in the BDC sector (BDCS -0.7%). The company's just-published investor day presentation is typical conference stuff - showing how the company is different (and superior) to its sector brethren, explaining the opportunities in lower and middle-market lending, and including several case studies. Also notably lower: MCG Capital (MCGC -1.6%), Prospect (PSEC -1.3%), and Hercules (HTGC -1%).

     
     
     
     
    | 1:43 PM | 16 Comments
  • GWPH

    GW Pharma (GWPH +1%) moves up after Canaccord initiated coverage earlier today with a Buy rating...

    GW Pharma (GWPH +1%) moves up after Canaccord initiated coverage earlier today with a Buy rating and a $13 price target.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:35 PM | 1 Comment
  • HYGS

    Hydrogenics (HYGS +7.2%) continues its relentless ascent. For those keeping score, the shares...

    Hydrogenics (HYGS +7.2%) continues its relentless ascent. For those keeping score, the shares are now up ~84% since SA Pro contributor Joe Springer said the stock "could triple" on May 23. (Previous: I, II)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:18 PM | 3 Comments
  • CASM

    CAS Medical Systems (CASM +4.6%) moves up after landing FDA 510(k) clearance for its...

    CAS Medical Systems (CASM +4.6%) moves up after landing FDA 510(k) clearance for its next-generation 740 SelectTM vital signs monitor and its MAX IQ non-invasive blood pressure technology. The company plans to begin filling orders during Q313.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:50 PM
  • CTCT

    E-mail/social media marketing software firm Constant Contact (CTCT +4.5%) and cloud contact...

    E-mail/social media marketing software firm Constant Contact (CTCT +4.5%) and cloud contact center software firm inContact (SAAS +7.4%) join the list of names rallying on hopes the Salesforce-ExactTarget deal will spur further M&A activity. Wells Fargo observes Salesforce (CRM -3.1%) stated the bidding for ExactTarget (NYSE:ET-OLD) was competitive, which leads it to think SAP or IBM may be interested. Though wondering if Salesforce will be able to tie together its acquisitions, Om Malik thinks the deal makes sense on paper, given ExactTarget's e-mail-focused offerings add "more structure to Salesforce’s ambiguous sounding Marketing Cloud." Marc Benioff suggests Salesforce is now likely to "[take] a vacation" from M&A for 12-18 months.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM | 1 Comment
  • UNXL

    UniPixel (UNXL +6.7%) rallies after announcing it's showing off 10.1" and 13.3" UniBoss touch...

    UniPixel (UNXL +6.7%) rallies after announcing it's showing off 10.1" and 13.3" UniBoss touch sensor prototypes at this week's Computex trade show. The company says the prototypes are the same ones it recently showed off at Cowen and Craig-Hallum conferences, and don't "show any extraneous effects when viewing the display." Shares remain well below where they traded before SA contributor Seth Shaw posted pictures of UniBoss demo units with visible lines in a Friday column.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:20 PM | 4 Comments
  • TXN

    Chip stocks outperform (SOXX +1.4%) after Microchip raises its June quarter guidance, and...

    Chip stocks outperform (SOXX +1.4%) after Microchip raises its June quarter guidance, and STMicroelectronics raises its 2013 guidance. Microchip rivals Texas Instruments (TXN +2.6%), Atmel (ATML +3.4%), and Freescale (FSL +2.1%) are among the winners, as is STMicroelectronics rival NXP (NXPI +3.6%). Also, Altera (ALTR +2.5%) is rallying with the help of an upgrade to Buy from Argus, and Intersil (ISIL +2.4%) is benefiting from a bullish coverage launch from Piper. Some chip ETFs: SMH, XSD, PSI, SOXL, USD, SOXS, SSG.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:05 PM
  • PBTH

    Prolor Biotech (PBTH -2%) says it's initiated Phase III clinical trials of hGH-CTP, a human...

    Prolor Biotech (PBTH -2%) says it's initiated Phase III clinical trials of hGH-CTP, a human growth hormone that provides deficient adults and children with hGH therapy that may require only once-weekly or bi-monthly injections, rather than the daily injections required by current hGH therapy.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:54 AM
  • QEP

    QEP Resources (QEP +3.5%) is one of the biggest gainers in the S&P 500 after the oil...

    QEP Resources (QEP +3.5%) is one of the biggest gainers in the S&P 500 after the oil and gas E&P company provided an operations update yesterday. QEP says it has completed and turned to sales its first four-well pad on the South Antelope property in North Dakota's Williston Basin, and completed nine new wells at the Fort Berthold Indian Reservation.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:43 AM
  • MACK

    Merrimack Pharmaceuticals (MACK -4.3%) says that results from a Phase 1 clinical study show that...

    Merrimack Pharmaceuticals (MACK -4.3%) says that results from a Phase 1 clinical study show that its antibody MM-121 could be combined with standard doses of certain cytotoxic agents for investigation as treatment for patients with advanced solid tumors. MM-121 is a fully human monoclonal antibody that targets ErbB3, a cell surface receptor implicated in tumor growth.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:33 AM
  • INVN

    InvenSense (INVN +5.6%) jumps after Maxim reports the company has scored a motion sensor design...

    InvenSense (INVN +5.6%) jumps after Maxim reports the company has scored a motion sensor design win for the next version of Google's Nexus 7 - the current model also uses an InvenSense sensor chip. The next-gen 7 is expected to launch this summer, and could be aggressively priced.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:30 AM | 3 Comments
  • IONS

    Needham & Co. analyst Chad Messer thinks Isis Pharmaceuticals (ISIS +2.2%) can go 20% higher...

    Needham & Co. analyst Chad Messer thinks Isis Pharmaceuticals (ISIS +2.2%) can go 20% higher from current levels. Messer likes the progress on ISIS-STAT3Rx and says recent developments with partner AstraZeneca "help establish ISIS as an up-and-coming cancer player." (Previous: ISIS earns milestone payment from AZN)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM
  • HSII

    Heidrick & Struggles (HSII +2.4%) jumps after confirming reports that it has been approached...

    Heidrick & Struggles (HSII +2.4%) jumps after confirming reports that it has been approached regarding a possible sale of the company. As a result of the overture, HSII's board will now review strategic alternatives. The shares are up 23% since spiking at around 2:00 Monday afternoon. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:16 AM
  • RGDX

    Response Genetics (OTC:RGDX -2.7%) says it's reached its second milestone payment hurdle in...

    Response Genetics (OTC:RGDX -2.7%) says it's reached its second milestone payment hurdle in conjunction with a licensing agreement with GlaxoSmithKline (NYSE:GSK) signed in 2010 to develop its BRAF-Inhibitor Tafinlar. Under the terms of the agreement, GSK gained certain rights to Response Genetics' proprietary PCR analysis technology and diagnostic expertise which received premarket approval from the FDA in May.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:12 AM
  • ABM

    ABM Industries (ABM +2.4%) enjoys a strong session after FQ2 earnings come in ahead of...

    ABM Industries (ABM +2.4%) enjoys a strong session after FQ2 earnings come in ahead of expectations. From the report: Adjusted EPS rises 20% Y/Y as the janitorial, facility services, and security segments see organic growth of 2.7%, 8.4%, and 3% respectively. CEO Henrik Slipsager says "recent project wins, a strong sales pipeline, and an improving economy, [leave ABM] well positioned for sustained growth." The company ups its full year EPS guidance to $1.40-1.50 versus consensus of $1.40. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:07 AM
  • HE

    Hawaiian Electric (HE -2.5%) slips this morning after lowering its FY13 EPS guidance to $1.52 -...

    Hawaiian Electric (HE -2.5%) slips this morning after lowering its FY13 EPS guidance to $1.52 - $1.62, from its previous range of $1.58 - $1.68. Analysts were expecting an EPS of $1.64. The company cites the final rate case decision and order issued by the Hawaiian Public Utilities Commission in May as the reason for the cut, which translates into $7.8M lower MECO annual revenues.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:52 AM | 2 Comments
  • MKTO

    Marketo (MKTO -10.5%) gives back its early gains, and then some, as investors decide the...

    Marketo (MKTO -10.5%) gives back its early gains, and then some, as investors decide the Salesforce-ExactTarget deal is bad news if a suitor doesn't come knocking. Roth points out Marketo gets 90% of its revenue from Salesforce's customer base, and thinks Salesforce's purchase of a rival could cause "medium-term problems." Also: many thought Marketo, rather than ExactTarget, would be the cloud marketing automation firm Salesforce would go after. Responsys (MKTG +7.5%) remains sharply higher.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:26 AM | 1 Comment
  • MGT

    MGT Capital Investments (MGT -3.3%) sells its portfolio of medical imaging patents to a major...

    MGT Capital Investments (MGT -3.3%) sells its portfolio of medical imaging patents to a major Asian conglomerate for around $1.5M, thereby transitioning it to a company focused soley on internet and mobile gaming. The company expects to deploy the funds in the skill-based gaming space at present, while its board considers other avenues to enhance shareholder value.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:26 AM
  • GIII

    Shares of G-III Apparal (GIII +17.3%) are rip-roaring higher after the retailer puts in a strong...

    Shares of G-III Apparal (GIII +17.3%) are rip-roaring higher after the retailer puts in a strong Q1 across product categories. A resurgence in the Calvin Klein brand helped boost results during the quarter.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:10 AM
  • XSPA

    Vringo (VRNG -2.8%), VirnetX (VHC -4.5%), Acacia (ACTG -7.7%), Wi-Lan (WILN -2.2%), and RPX...

    Vringo (VRNG -2.8%), VirnetX (VHC -4.5%), Acacia (ACTG -7.7%), Wi-Lan (WILN -2.2%), and RPX (RPXC -1.8%) slide after the WSJ reports Pres. Obama is expected to announce 5 executive actions and 7 legislative proposals taking aim at perceived patent trolls, including legislation enabling sanctions against litigants filing lawsuits deemed abusive, and orders to the USPTO to "train examiners to scrutinize applications for overly broad patent claims." The report follow harsh Feb. remarks from Obama about patent trolls, as well as recent DOJ/FTC hearings regarding their activity.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:04 AM | 7 Comments
  • CTCT

    Cloud fever: Shares of Constact Contact (CTCT +3.7%) are also getting pushed higher on optimism...

    Cloud fever: Shares of Constact Contact (CTCT +3.7%) are also getting pushed higher on optimism in the sector after Salesforce paid a sweet premium for ExactTarget.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:00 AM
  • MBOT

    StemCells (STEM +3.9% to $1.85) agrees to a $30M financing deal with Chicago-based Lincoln Park...

    StemCells (STEM +3.9% to $1.85) agrees to a $30M financing deal with Chicago-based Lincoln Park in which the latter will buy $3M worth of StemCells' stock immediately at $1.823 each and another $27M over the next three years. StemCells will control the timing of any future transactions and is not obligated to sell the shares, although Lincoln will be obligated to buy them. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:59 AM
  • PSTI

    Pluristem Therapeutics (NASDAQ:PSTI) resumes trading 14.4% lower after shares were halted...

    Pluristem Therapeutics (NASDAQ:PSTI) resumes trading 14.4% lower after shares were halted following news that the FDA has suspended the Phase II trials for the company's placenta-based cell treatment for artery disease.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:52 AM
  • XRDC

    Keating Capital (KIPO +7.8%) opens sharply higher after CEO Tim Keating takes to Seeking Alpha...

    Keating Capital (KIPO +7.8%) opens sharply higher after CEO Tim Keating takes to Seeking Alpha to defend the stock in response to another SA contributor calling the shares a short.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:45 AM
  • RIOM

    Rio Alto Mining (RIOM -4.1%) temporarily suspends mining activities at its La Arena Gold Oxide...

    Rio Alto Mining (RIOM -4.1%) temporarily suspends mining activities at its La Arena Gold Oxide Mine in Peru due to a blockade of the Trujillo to Huamachuco public road, the main access route for people and supplies. RIOM says 2013 total gold production may be negatively impacted due to the situation.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:40 AM
  • MNST

    Shares of Monster Beverage (MNST +4.2%) rally after Goldman Sachs issues a note to clients...

    Shares of Monster Beverage (MNST +4.2%) rally after Goldman Sachs issues a note to clients indicating that the firm's sales accelerated in May.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:36 AM | 5 Comments
  • PSTI

    Pluristem Therapeutics's (NASDAQ:PSTI) shares are halted after it says that the FDA has...

    Pluristem Therapeutics's (NASDAQ:PSTI) shares are halted after it says that the FDA has suspended the Phase II trial of the company's placenta-based cell treatment for artery disease following "a serious allergic reaction" that caused the patient to be hospitalized. The patient has multiple diseases, "which may have influenced the severity of the event," and was discharged from hospital the following day. Shares are due to resume trading at 9:45. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:31 AM
  • CP

    Bill Ackman's decision to sell a 30% chunk of his Canadian Pacific (NYSE:CP) holdings triggers a...

    Bill Ackman's decision to sell a 30% chunk of his Canadian Pacific (NYSE:CP) holdings triggers a downgrade from RBC, which thinks the sale may mark a shift to longer-term shareholders from momentum-driven catalyst investors. The firm says CP shares are pricing in a level of earnings growth that exceeds long-term financial targets, implying a fundamental share value 10%-30% below current levels. CP -4.1% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM
  • ROSG-OLD

    Rosetta Genomics (NASDAQ:ROSG-OLD), which recently signed its first U.S. PPO agreement, rises...

    Rosetta Genomics (NASDAQ:ROSG-OLD), which recently signed its first U.S. PPO agreement, rises 6.5% premarket after saying it is expanding its sales presence in the U.S. to 12 territories from five.     Responsys (NASDAQ:MKTG) +10.5% and Marketo (NASDAQ:MKTO) +5.7% following news Salesforce (NYSE:CRM) is buying cloud marketing automation software rival ExactTarget for $2.5B (a 53% premium). Salesforce has long been expected to make a cloud marketing acquisition following Oracle's purchase of Eloqua, and the deal might pressure rivals (Microsoft? SAP?) to make a similar move. Salesforce promises to add ExactTarget's software to its Marketing Cloud platform, which includes social media marketing software from the Buddy Media and Radian6 acquisitions, as well as the Social.com app.

    STMicroelectronics (NYSE:STM) rises 4.4% in Paris after CEO Carlo Bozotti tells Le Figaro that he is targeting order growth of 5-10% this year following an increase of 5% in Q1. The plan is to eventually achieve annual turnover of $9B (the figure was $8.49B in 2012). Bozotti notes that every 1% change in the euro-dollar rate "has an impact of €35M on operating profit per year."

  • The Nikkei continues its yo-yoing, jumping 2% today after its sharp fall yesterday and as the...

    The Nikkei continues its yo-yoing, jumping 2% today after its sharp fall yesterday and as the yen weakens against the dollar. The moves follow soft U.S. manufacturing data yesterday, which eased fears about the Fed's QE program and have also helped to boost European stocks in early trading. However, Chinese shares drop, partly due to investors taking profits on small-caps. Hong Kong flat, China -1.2%, India +0.2%. EU Stoxx 50 +0.7%, London +0.5%, Paris +0.7%, Frankfurt +0.8%, Madrid +0.9%, Milan +1%.
